summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Ad Hoc Committee on Legislative Affairs of the Dallas City Council will convene on May 7, 2024, at 9:00 AM in the Council Chambers, 6th Floor, City Hall. The meeting will be accessible both in-person and via videoconference, aiming to discuss legislative priorities for the upcoming year.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the December 11, 2023, meeting.
2. A briefing on the 2025 Federal Legislative Priorities, including an overview of the process for determining these priorities.

**Important Details**:  
The committee will consider the strategic direction for federal legislative initiatives that will impact Dallas, with input from various government affairs personnel. This discussion will help shape the city’s legislative agenda and priorities for the upcoming federal legislative session.

**Action Items**:  
The committee is seeking approval of the previous meeting's minutes and will deliberate on the proposed federal legislative priorities for 2025. Decisions made during this meeting will guide the city’s legislative strategy moving forward. 

The meeting will also include provisions for an executive session if necessary, to discuss sensitive legal or real estate matters.
